x86x64::X86X64CallNodeÂ¶

struct asmjit::x86x64::X86X64CallNode
#include <x86compiler.h>

X86/X64 function-call node.

Public Functions

X86X64CallNode(BaseCompiler * compiler, const Operand & target)

Create a new X86X64CallNode instance.

~X86X64CallNode()

Destroy the X86X64CallNode instance.

X86X64FuncDecl * getDecl()

Get function prototype.

ASMJIT_API Error setPrototype(uint32_t conv, const FuncPrototype & p)

Set function prototype.

ASMJIT_API bool _setArg(uint32_t i, const Operand & op)

Set argument at i to op.

ASMJIT_API bool _setRet(uint32_t i, const Operand & op)

Set return at i to op.

bool setArg(uint32_t i, const BaseVar & var)

Set argument at i to var.

bool setArg(uint32_t i, const Imm & imm)

Set argument at i to imm.

bool setRet(uint32_t i, const BaseVar & var)

Set return at i to var.

Public Members

X86X64FuncDecl _x86Decl

X86 declaration.

RegMask _usedArgs

Mask of all registers actually used to pass function arguments.

Note
This bit-mask is not the same as X86X64Func::_passed. It contains only registers actually used to do the call while X86X64Func::_passed mask contains all registers for all function prototype combinations.

X86X64CallNode(const X86X64CallNode & other)
